text:
I think for future
me, I just want to provide for my family

and give back to those who have helped
get me to where I am today.

My name is José Tapia,
but people call me Pepe.

I'm currently studying computer science
at Cal State Fullerton,

specializing in artificial intelligence
and machine learning.
My name is Olympiah Otieno,
and I'm from Nairobi, Kenya.
I'm from Himachal Pradesh, India.
I'm interested in artificial intelligence.
If they can do it, then I can do it too.

What I love about
AI and ML is the creative potential

it has The most complex problems
become easily solvable. I'm

excited to help families and communities
create stronger bonds
using AI and ML.
My parents migrated over from
Mexico back in the eighties.
My dad was a landscaper working full time.

My mom was a housekeeper
working full time.

It was definitely rough where they weren't
always around with each other

to solve their problems
and they weren't always around to solve
my problems.
I have two younger brothers,

two older sisters, and definitely had to
be the bigger brother for the whole family

and take on a lot of responsibilities
at a young age.

In high school I was a 2.0
GPA student, barely getting by.
I had no sense of direction.

I didn't understand, like how to either
get back on track or what track
I was even on.

After a series of bad decisions,
I got in trouble with the law
and I fell into a deep depression.
I felt like there was no way out of it.
And that's where Risa came in.
She was the light that I needed
to believe in myself again.

And then going to her
graduation was the biggest

click of “This is what I could try to be
and this is what I could try to do”.

Because of her, I enrolled in college
and I became passionate
about changing my life, my way.

I want to just inspire the community
that supported me,

but also just my brothers,
especially as a Hispanic person
going to school at CSU Fullerton,

saying that I'm studying AI and ML,
that was really important for me.

You don't really see
a lot of Hispanic people

in a strong technology
or like mathematical background.

Being up in Fullerton
and my brother down in Escondido,

I've been missing a lot of my brother's
basketball games.

I wanted to use AI and ML to create a tool
that can help me
watch those games from home.

I'm currently working on a project
that uses a camera

and a Raspberry
Pi to record a basketball game
Through AWS,

you can create a full live stream set up
that records the game

and using machine learning and artificial
intelligence, create highlights, point

the camera in certain directions
and keep track of certain players

all automatically
and a person will be able to log on,

watch all their clips for their child
and create special moments.
Growing up, I played basketball as well.
There'd be a lot of weeks where my parents
would just not be able to go to the games.
And when you're not there in the moment,

it's really something special
that you're missing out on.
But if you can go back

and relive those moments through a simple,
affordable recording software
that would make the difference

between a parent and a kid
really sharing a genuine moment long term.
Without the AWS AI and ML

Scholarship, I wouldn't have been able
to develop my own questions,

know what tools are available
to solve them, and be confident with start

to finish
making a product within AI and ML.

I would encourage anyone,
whether you're a self-starter

or you're going to school
to take the AWS Scholarship

because it will take whatever
path you're on and enhance it.
